metadata.synopsis: A mysterious gunfighter (Lee Van Cleef) protects a man accused of killing an Arizona big shot.

reviews: While die hard fans of this era and this genre might find much to appreciate, The Grand Duel still plays like B-side filler compared to the (now) greats it borrows from heavily.
At times feeling like an opera, it's a Western which harks back to the greats of the proceeding two decades.
The pacing is fine, and the action is clean.
